thread.title: 8 of two families die in accident in Ahmedabad
thread.title_full: 8 of two families die in accident in Ahmedabad - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: 8 of two families die in accident in Ahmedabad
text:
AHMEDABAD: Seven members of two families from Rajkot were killed on the spot, while one of the two seriously injured succumbed to injuries while being taken to a hospital when the car they were travelling in collided with a truck on Wednesday on Viramgam- Lakhtar Highway.
Of the deceased four were women and four males. The traffic was disrupted for a few hours following the accident on the highway said a senior police official of Viramgam rural police station.
Two families, residents of Mavdi village of Rajkot, were on their way to a pilgrimage to Shihor village of Detroj Taluka by a car. "They had left Rajkot late on the intervening night of Tuesday and Wednesday," said a police official.
"On Wednesday morning on Lakhtar-Viramgam Highway the car while trying to overtake another vehicle rammed into the truck head on coming from the opposite direction. Seven of the nine occupants of the car were killed on the spot, while one of the two succumbed to the injuries while being rushed to a hospital," said the official.
The deceased were identified as Kalu Gamara, Shailiesh Gamara, Bhanu Gamara, Pushpa Tretiya, Girish Tretiya, Kakeshwari Tretiya, Vibha tretiya and driver of the car, Nanji Saparia.
The bodies were handed over to the family members of the deceased after post mortem. "We've registered a case of fatal road accident and are hunting for the driver of the truck who fled after the accident," said a senior police official.
